results.title: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner's Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Turner’s Syndrome affects one in every 2000-2500 females. A genetic disorder due to the absence of an X chromosome, it usually leads to growth difficulties, infertility and, in some cases, learning difficulties, particularly with mathematics and spatial relationships.
These twelve stories are by those who have lived with Turner’s Syndrome, either by being diagnosed with it or caring for a child with the disorder. The inspiring stories are about living with Turner’s Syndrome and not letting it prevent them from living a normal life.
results.title_for_label: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner’s Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Hidden India
results.creator_credit: Dennis Porter, Ian Austin and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a complex country of multiple languages, lifestyles, religions and cultures which are thousands of years old, a country of hidden wonders which the average tourist never sees. This documentary explores many of these wonders and vividly recounts, even dramatically reconstructs some of India’s intriguing stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Porter, Ian Austin and East Coast Productions

results.title: Hidden factors
results.brief_description: Environmentally responsible high yield plantations are one approach taken by the Shell company to relieve the pressure on natural forests. This program looks at the fundamental structure of the forest ecology and soils, and shows how this has led to the failure of many plans for their alternative use, particularly when environmental considerations are not given enough importance in economic terms. Finally, the program shows examples of economic and environmentally sound management projects. It advocates for recognition of the inestimable value of the rich and varied resources of natural forests, and argues that the preservation of those that remain must become a global responsibility and not another burden on those nations least able to afford it.

results.title: Hidden faces
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary about Egyptian women’s lives in contemporary Muslim society and the effects of Islam on their lives. An Egyptian woman, Saafa Fathay, working as a researcher, and now living in Paris, has been commissioned to work as an interviewer on a film. She goes back to her country to meet the internationally celebrated feminist writer, Nawal el Sadawi, whom she has always admired. Rather than do a conventional portrait of the famous writer as another film crew are doing, and knowing the terrain intimately, she uses Nawal’s writings as a springboard to examining her own upbringing and the lives of her sisters and cousins. In Arabic and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Hidden depths
results.brief_description: A three part series on the possible causes, symptoms and treatment for depression as practised by psychologists and mental health support groups in London. The programs feature both professionals who treat depression and sufferers of the complaint.

results.title: Hidden agenda
results.creator_credit: Eric Fellner, Hemdale Film Corporation and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: American lawyer Paul Sullivan (Brad Dourif), is working in Northern Ireland as part of a group similar to Amnesty International, when he is assassinated by police who claimed that he failed to stop at a road block and was in the company of a suspected terrorist. His fiancee and fellow activist Ingrid Jessner (Frances McDormand) is left shattered. She has a glimmer of hope that justice will prevail after the arrival of British policeman Paul Kerrigan (Brian Cox) who has been sent to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death, and the actions of the three men implicated in the deaths: members of the undercover anti terrorist squad, the SSU (Special Support Unit). Kerrigan is initially fearless in his investigation, refusing the protection offered to him by the RUC in an effort to remain impartial to people who may be involved. However, when he uncovers a conspiracy to destabilize the previous Labour government, he is faced with the consequences of disclosing the information. Ken Loach based his film on the Stalker affair - the real life case of senior police official John Stalker, assigned to investigate a killing by British security officials. Stalker was removed from the case amidst speculations that the then Thatcher government was unhappy with his findings. Screenplay by Jim Allen.

results.title: Hibiscus town = Furong zhen [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Xie Jin
results.brief_description: A romantic melodrama which follows the fortunes of a bean curd seller, Hu Yuyin, through the political turmoil of the early sixties, the purges at the height of the Cultural Revolution in the mid-sixties and the end of mass persecution and rehabilitation of ‘rightists’ in the late seventies. The film spans the period by honing in on Hu’s life in three years (1963, 1966, 1979). Hu, as a small businesswoman, is the target for the hardline militants but she is a survivor. She forms a relationship with Qui, reviled by the militants. Hu and Qui are branded as a ‘black couple’ and reduced to street sweepers. This is veteran director Xie Jin’s attempt to answer the challenge of the ‘Fifth Generation’ filmmakers by making a film with a critical edge. It was a popular success in China. Cast includes Liu Xiaoquing, Jiang Wen and Zheng Zaishi. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
